HER HERE HERE!!! GO TO THIS WEBSITE!!! http://www.geocities.com/mysterykid_13/ Go under Tenchi Muyo and right click on "ending theme," and "save target as." Trust me, I WAS in the crappiest mood, but this song cheered me up! It may only be a MIDI, but trust me, please, it cheers you up in a jiffy, and you know who it made me want to listen to it, and I don't know why... THATS RIGHT! KYLE!!! lol! I LLLLLOOOOOVVVEEE THIS SONG!!! DO IT!!! AND ENVISION A SUNNY DAY WITH A LARGE GRREN FIELD, A QUIET FRIENDLY VILLAGE, AND YOU WALKING and/or SKIPPING THROUGH BOTH!!! ME, myself...*ahem*...inawhiteflowydresswithpinkflowersandabonnetwithapinkribbonaroundit.... he he he

Here is an 80's song that I have loved and danced to since I have been 8 years old, so I am an expert at this song! IT'S A W E S O M E!!! But I need a partner, so it's hard to dance to alone. Well, My baby and me went out late Saturday night I had my hair piled high and my baby just looked so right Well, pick you up at ten, gotta have you home at two Mama don't know what I got in store for you But that's all right cause we're looking as cool as can be Well, we found a little place that really didn't look half bad I had a whisky on the rocks And change of a dollar for the jukebox Well, I put the cold rock into that can But all they played was disco, man Come on, baby, baby, let's get out of here right away We're gonna rock this town Rock it inside out We're gonna rock this town Make'em scream and shout Let's rock, rock, rock, man, rock We're gonna rock till you pop We're gonna rock till you drop We're gonna rock this town Rock it inside out Well, we're having a ball just 'a bopping on the big dance floor Well, there's a real square cat, he looks a 1974 Well, he looked at me once, he looked at me twice Look at me again and there's gonna be fight We're gonna rock this town We're gonna rip this place apart We're gonna rock this town Rock it inside out We're gonna rock this town Make'em scream and shout Let's rock, rock, rock, man, rock We're gonna rock till you pop We're gonna rock till you drop We're gonna rock this town Rock this place apart

Hey! Pals, friends, and everyone who views this! (especially Robin and Kyle) go to this address: http://www.theotaku.com If you go to the fanart in the top menu, then scroll down past the newest fanart and such, you will find 2 colomns. Go the the most popular artists and click on the artist Seifer Sama. He is one of my online buddies and he is really cool! We exchange fanart sometimes, too! But I don't post mine because my scanner go broken by my bratty little jerk of a frickin' brother. Anyways, trust me, it's really cool!

AAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHRRGGH!!! I got the review for science, which I will complete today after school and tomorrow during resource, and for math, which I will do on Friday, and BOTH are packets, which will take forever, especially the SCIENCE one. The ones I will REALLY have to study for, though, are English, S.S, Spanish, and Science...the rest are easy. Today, I have the task to myself to find, and download, Blink 182's song "I Miss You," or I will go CRAZY! And, the song "Maps," by the Yeah Yeah Yeahs. Ok...overloaded work for EVER...is out....bye-e! till next time.

Hey cool...I figured it out! Today was a nerve wrecking day, although it turned out well. I had to do a speeck in advanced english and I couldn't stop shaking! YYYYEEAARRGGH!....*sigh* at least I got it done, and its the last one for the year! YAY!!! No oral com for me next year. So, anyways...here's some normal stuff... song in my head: Maps. by the yeah yeah yeahs thinking about: upcoming finals, the spanish oral to be exact things to do: study for finals and.....aaaaaannd....see if I can go the the new Harry Potter movie with my friends (Stephanie, ect.)

MMMMWWWWWWAAAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHSHSH *hack hack haaaack* *passes out on the floor out of spinning chair* Punk! My kind of friend. You could care less what other ppl think of you. You want friends who like you for who you are and not what you have. I mean, sure, sometimes you stick fries up your nose, but thats ok. People love you because you crack them up immensly! Your amoung friends! Rate my quiz fellow Homie! urlLink Are you one of the three P's? (Punk/Prep/Poser)? brought to you by urlLink Quizilla

Today we got to Cosmic Bowl at the bowling alley! You know, when the blacklights and multi-colored disco balls are all over the place. All my rave jewelery was glowing, and my pants were too, it was SO cool. But on the way there, Ezra got me wet with his hair, because he took a shower and shook his head because I asked him if he took a shower...I will never ask him that ever again, or go anywhere NEAR hi8m when he has wet hair. Then we played soccer, which was VERY tiring, when we got back. Oh....here are more quiz results o' mine! urlLink urlLink theOtaku.com: The Anime Friendship Quiz You're Element is Water. You are soft and serene at most times but like Wind, you're scary when you're mad. You proabaly have a talent is singing and even your speaking voice is lovely. You have an innocent type of beauty that makes you look younger than you are and you like close relationships with people. urlLink What's Your Element(girls)? (PICTURES) brought to you by urlLink Quizilla

Your Heart is Red urlLink What Color is Your Heart? brought to you by urlLink Quizilla Feminine urlLink What's your sexual appeal? brought to you by urlLink Quizilla You have a free soul! As all the souls go, yours is the most free-spirited and adventurous. You like camping, hiking, or interaction with other people. Your a social butterfly, but not because of your style, but because of your willingness to communicate with everyone. You probably have close friends who can rely on you because you always seem to know whats going on in the world. You love music and are free-spirited and someone fun to be around. A born leader and great explorer-dont ever change-the world needs more people like you. urlLink What Kind of SOUL do you posses? (For Girls only) Incredible Anime Pictures! brought to you by urlLink Quizilla

I went with my good friend Jerricka today to see the movie 'Dodgeball,' with one of my favorite actors in it: Ben Stiller! But, seriously, the movie is awesome! and worth the price of 5.00, including tax, to see it. If anyone says otherwise, it is probably because they are the Ben Stiller of dodgeball. Speaking of dodgeball, on the Game Show Network, dodgeball is now an actual competetive sport! When I watched it I could NOT stop laughing, and uttered over an over until my head fell off, "This is a joke, right?" The teams costumes are as ridiculous as the concept of taking an utterly traditional, cherished, and American sport of Elementary School dodgeball, and turning it into a laughable joke on the face of momentary pop culture. Any-ways... After me and Jerricka got back, we watched a terrible, TERRIBLE, TERRIBLE GOD-AWFUL movie called 'The Stuff.' It was SO bad that after this suck-fest, me and Jerry went outside and played frisbee and baseball with the DVD of this travesty on the art of film-making. It was VERY fun. OK.....bye.

More FUN quizzes....just for fun... BLUE You give your love and friendship unconditionaly. You enjoy long, thoughtful conversations rich in philosophy and spirituality. You are very loyal and intuitive. Find out your color at Quiz Me! find your inner PIE @ stvlive.com Discover your Zodiac Personality @ Quiz Me discover what candy you are @ quiz me

She wore a Raspberry beret The kind U find in a second hand store Raspberry beret And if it was warm she wouldn't wear much more Raspberry beret... I have had this song stuck in my head for the last...week, or so...don't get me wrong, I LOVE...ABSOLUTELY L O V E... this song, and if you haven't heard this great Prince song thats beat is bubbly-beyond-reason and catchy to the core...you should hear it, then you'll understand. And fate seems to have a way with me, because I was in my favorite vintage store (my secret fashion consulate) downtown, and on the wall for 4.00......was a RASPBERRY BERET!!! .....I know what you are asking yourself ....and Yes, I did get the hat, and joyously sang the Prince song as I pranced to the counter to purchase my now favorite hat. *grins bubbly* I am even wearing it as I type this entry...
Here is a quiz I took, again, with Robin's pessimistic guidence. The Completely Pointless Personality Quiz

So, the gym class I am in this summer seems like it is taking forever...F O R E V E R!!! We are working on Tennis, which I suck at, Softball, which I am good at, and Volleyball, which is so-so. It's a roller coaster of ability. Te-freakin'-he. Blah.

Sorry I have been gone so long, I was...uh...busy, I guess. On Friday I went shopping. Saturday I had the worst headache in the world and couldn't even stand up for a mini-ute without passing out, but the upside is that there were a lot of good movies and shows on the T.V. Sunday was a blah day, but my Dad and I ripped up the ugly carpeting on my parent's stairs going up to their bedroom and polished the really nice wood that was underneath it. And Today, my summer gym class started, and I met some new friends, and sported with my old (but still great, vintage if you may)friends, and a great part of that class is that Mr. Weber, my old elementary school teacher, teaches the class.

So, yeah, of course, I went to see the Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban on Friday at noon, and overall, despite the pickiness of OTHER people in this godforsaken have-to-be-perfect-and-can't-simply-enjoy-something-for-one-fricken'-moment...world, I would say it was pretty good. I guess, reading other peoples *ahem Robin's ahem* blogs, some people didn't like it, but I for one, DID!!! It was a GREAT movie, because I don't feel like picking things apart, and the critic almost NEVER gets the last laugh. Then, on Sunday, I went to Noah's Ark, and it was GREAT FUN, FABULOUS EVEN!!! I went with my Mother, Father, Brother, his friend Bobby, and my good friend Romi. We went on almost everything twice, except the Flash Flood, only me and my Dad went on that one...oh well, we all have our fears. My favorites are the dark rides, and the ever favorite wave pool, and someone, I won't say who, almost drown, and I saved them...and it scared me sooo bad! *shiver*

AAAAAHHH!!! I went to go see the third Harry Potter movie today, and it was AWESOME! It was SSSSOOOOOO good, I want to see it again and I will buy it the first day it comes out on DVD, whenever that may be. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS MOVIE TO ANYONE!!! AAAAHHH! IT WAS SO C-O-O-L!!! I LOVED IT SOOOOO MUCH!!! urlLink

IM OUTIE! OUT OUT OUT OUTOUTOUT, OH YEAHH, IM O-U-T, OUT!!!!! THANK GOD ITS OVER!!! But not all of it was bad, I made a lot of new friends and memories, and this summer is going to be a blast! The next exciting thing to happen to me will be Sunday, at Noah's Ark, and hopefully Romi will be able to sleep over Saturday night so we can go right away in the morning... IT IS GOING TO BE SOOOOOO MUUUCH F-U-N :P So...I said bye to almost everyone, and the one's I didn't get to, I will se next year anyways, and possibly in my summer gym class. Happy as a squirrel on a nut farm and A tiger in a room full of rabbits, i'm signing off, Bye-e till' next time everyone! ~WELCOME TO SUMMER~

YYYYYYYYYYYYYYEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE-HHHHHHHHAAAAAAAAAA!!!!!!!!! WWWWWWWHHHHHHOOOOOOOOO-HHHHHHHOOOOOOO!!!! THATS HOW PUMPED I AM!!! YYYYYYYAAAAAAAAHHHHHHH!!!!! *runs around in circles* *whoo* I took my History, Science, and Math finals today, and surprisingly, they were pretty easy, considering i didn't study as hard as I should of or as much as all of my brainy friends. I had "Ride on Shooting Star," stuck in my head ALL DAY today, again. BUT IT IS AN INCREDIBLY EASY SONG TO GET IN YOUR HEAD, EVEN IF YOU DON'T KNOW JAPANESE LYRICS LIKE I DO! Here are the lyrics, but it's easier to understand them if you've heard the song: ORENJI no SURAIDO utsusu sora SUPONJI no PURAIDO burasa gete SUPAIDAA teketotta so no yuka wa kakusa naku tatteiinda ra no tsuita yume mitai na ride on shooting star kokoro no koede san tanzu no youni rai tsuzuketa KURANJI no HAMUSUTAA otonabi de RIBENJI no ROBUSUTAA kikijurete SUNAIPAA kochitotta sono sekai ni ani ga mierutte yuunda rau mai ni soware tai na ride on shooting star kimi wo sagashite kin da shoujo juu so wo tsuita ride on shooting star kokoro no koede san tanzu no youni rai tsuzuketa The show that it is the end song to is FLCL, it's on at 11:00 on Saturday nights on Cartoon network, it's part of adult swim. It is a REALLY cool show, it is SO me.

Well, this weekend was....fun? Oh, yeah...it was! On Saturday I went downtown to the best store EVER (opinions may differ), which is Deaf Ear records. I got 2 CDs and an AWESOME sticker of Weezer. The 2 Cd's included an 80's rock CD with 3 of my favorite 80's songs out of 100 top favorites, which include "Turning Japanese," "Too Shy," and, "Always Something There To Remind Me." The other CD was "Insomniac," by *drumroll*....Green Day!!! Big Surprise there :P. The Rest of the weekend was boring, and I prepared for finals. Today, I took the Art, English, and Spanish finals, which were surprisingly easy. I had the song "Ride On Shooting Star" by The Pillows, the theme of my favorite show in the whole world FLCL, stuck in my head ALL DAY.....I highly recommend downloading it. *cough* *cough* * http://digikawaii.tripod.com/main.html/ * Anyways...seeya. (P

Well, I finally, FINALLY finished my pixel doll of Ed from Cowboy Bebop.Today, we went up to Viroqua and Westby to visit where Nana grew up, and that was fun. I bought a 20's hat, you know, the ones that have the skimpy top to hold the veil. It's really cool, I love it, obviously. We also went to the resturant that was in the Jeopardy question about a couple weeks ago...the name escapes me right now. We, of course, couldn't leave without going to the Westby creamery and buying some cheese curds, RIGHT before they closed to our good fortune and your dismay, hahahahahaha. Then, to MY terrible dismay, we had to go into the Scandenavian gift shop at my Nana's request...I LOATH that store to DEATH...AAARRRGH! So TACKY and townie it drives me nuts...not that a little townie is bad, but Norwegian townie is the WORST. Anyways, I survived, if I didn't, please bury me with all my stuff, because you know its mine.

Category X - The Changeling Witty, amusing and a bit weird, you're welcomed into most social groups, even though you don't 'fit in' perfectly . urlLink What Type of Social Entity are You? brought to you by urlLink Quizilla

Today, I went shopping, like I said, with my Nana and Mother. I got 50.00 from Nana for my Birthday to spend and 40.00 from my bank account, and then...went nuts. The first thing I bought was from foot locker...A pair of Pink Converses, high top, because low tops suck. Then, here are the rest of my purchases, along with getting my left ear cartilage pierced: -A 'The Doors' patch from Indian Weavings -A rainbow bracelet, keychain, and a Happy Bunny button that says: "crazy doesn't even begin to describe it." I also got a button that says "Yes, it does hurt being this good looking." -A pair of pink pants, retro gray on top of white ripped t-shirt, and neon striped shirt from DEB. -A My Little Pony charm...hehehehehehe...I am a girl. -A Strawberry Shortcake doll...hehehehehehe.... -A pink poodle Beanie Baby...hehehehehe...MMMMWWWAAAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!! More to come...I still have 40.00 left, and a vintage store to hit, along with another mall, and Deaf Ear records for buttons/patches/CDs/a band t-shirt.

That was SSSOOOOO much fun, and I didn't realize that I enjoyed watching Baseball that much, until I started cheering like a lunatic for the Cubs. Don't get me wrong, there is definately a place in my person for the Brewers, but I was raised a Cubs fan. All I need now is a small Cubs button to put on my jacket or purse, I have been on a huge button hunt because I feel like it, and I have found some nice patches, but I will tell you about my purchases in Milwaukee later on in my post. Any-ways, after that, as you could imagine, there was a HUGE traffic backup and we were too impatient to wait, and be SAFE, so we accidentally ended up in the projects/ghetto/da hood, of Milwaukee. My parents were panicing, but I wasn't...because, well, I just wasn't... When we got back to the hotel I fell asleep, woke up at about 9:00, we left at about 10:00, then went SHOPPING!!! WweEeEeEeEeEeEEEEEE!!!! We went to a mall in Milwaukee, and the Johnson Creek mall outlet place, and here is what I bought: -Invader Zim choking GIR cuff from Hot Topic -GIR patch hitchhiker from H.T -My Little Pony patch from H.T -GIR in the air with tongue out catching candy; says "Whooooo-Hooooo!!! CANDY!!!" on the bottom; postcard -Red pants from Pac Sun -Polka-dotted (black and white)tube top from some preppy store -Pink foil studded bracelet from Claires (Ah, what the hey) and there is more to come, because I plan on taking my Nana shoppin at the mall on Friday when my Papa, Dad, and Alex are at the Brewers and Cubs game. Seeya...bye.

OK, so, we got to Yogi, and did practically nothing the Sunday we got there, except the candy bar horse races. The next day, me and Brittany went for many walks and tried to find the skate park, and on the way were asked by at least 5 golf carts if we wanted a ride. It was weird and...well, weird, but still pretty cool. Brittany and I came up with soooo many personal jokes...i'll type them in some other time, there are so many of them. Then, and Wednesday night, we managed to meet 2 new guy friends who we had seen throughout the park on the previous days, including Joe, who was the guy I was hell-bent on finding out his name instead of referring to him as 'blondie,'he's cool and I miss him, and Jessie, who liked Brittany more, but I didn't really care too much. No highlights from there I can think of except for my Birthday...gimmie a break, do you KNOW what TIME it is? I can't sleep, and that's why i'm up. I got a lot of great gifts, the best being the black and white striped shirt I got and the 15.00 CD gift cirtificates for ShopKo (.....where the heck else would they be for...) and a 30.00 gift certificate to Deaf Ear record, an awesome Cd, vinyl, and sticker/button/patch store that I LOVE going to. I also got a lot of Jewelery...because, you know, I WEAR A LOT OF IT! I got some scetch pads and...oh yeah! The best, actually, gifts I got were the *drumroll*.... first and second season of AQUA TEEN HUNGER FORCE!!! YEAH, BABY!!! Now all I can do is sit here and eat my Pops cereal at the computer, and maybe i'll find the time to e-mail Joe...or Jessie...who knows. In the mean time, my Dad and Uncle Bob should be waking up, but I am the only one awake, and the first too, and that NEVER happens. My Grandmother is coming over to visit family and my parents for their anniversary (weird that it's the day after my B-day) and give me my gifts, and we are also going to the old train tunnel that has no lights and is about a mile long...but really fun and creepy... well, better go, here's a shout-out to my new guy pals, Joe and Jessie, Love and Life to you both (Jessie! step AWAY from the skateboard!) Bye 4 now, Angelica

Hey y'all, this is Brittany, Angelica's Cuz! HI!! Me and her are hangin here at her house this fine ummm i guess morning now :-P...im almost done braiding allllllll of her hair, and iv already been at it for 2, yes 2 hours!! So here's a great story...we were up in her room, me braidin her hair, and my sister, sarah, sees this box of 'ribbon candy'... and of course sarah, being my sister decides she wants some. So she asks Angelica, and Angelica says yes, being the good cuzin she is. All of a sudden I, Brittany, realize..."THAT CANDY IS FROM CHRISTMAS!!" ok, so this is ribbon candy, a HARD candy, hmmm at least it's suppose to be HARD! Now seeing as how this candy is 6, YES 6 months old, it has gone SOFT!! EWWWW, who eats that, us!! We eat it!! Of course i have the concern of POISONING, but hey, its fine, we're healthy enough! Then Angelica has to make the great remark about GUYS!!! "guys are HARD until they see their gramma NAKED, then you get the SOFT candy!!" oh god are we ever weird! Well i think that's it...im sure when we come back from Jellystone in like 5 dayz we will have plenty more stories for y'all out there! Until then, please leave your nice comments to me, Brittany, and/or Angelica! I hope you all have a GREAT weekend! MuAh!! :-* Love, Brittany And Angelica!! :-D

I can't wait till Sunday! I get to go to Yogi Bear in Warrens, and for more info., go to their website. And my cousins Brittany and brat, I mean, Sarah *cough cough*, along w/ my Aunt and Uncle, are coming up today to camp for 4 days with us. In other news, I FINALLY found the theme song to Cowboy Bebop, 'Tank', and D'd it to my PL. It's so Jazzy, I love it. and the show is really cool too! My favorite character is Ed, because she's crazy, and knows a lot aboot computer's, like me!

Some songs make you think of the way this world works...how much we actually do suffer, no matter what race. We get so caught up in our own petty problems we can't stop to realize that there are actually people out there that are suffering much worse than you are. No matter how big you think your problem is.... ...and truly think about that... ....there are still bigger ones out there that matter to more than one person..... .....more than one society...... .....more than one race...... As I sat on my bed a few days ago, I heard a song that made me truly think about this world, and how much we have not changed in the past 10 or 20 years for the better. No matter how much we say we care about each other, we are still killing each other for reasons that are temporary, we even kill ourselves for temporary, solvable, reasons. It seems that nobody can lean on or talk to anyone without a sacrifice or cost to their being and mind...an insecurity that comes from our own doubts and pessimistic alligations. So as the song by Tupac Shakur, "Changes," wisely shines light on, "We gotta start makin' changes learn to see me as a brother instead of 2 distant strangers and that's how it's supposed to be How can the Devil take a brother if he's close to me? I'd love to go back to when we played as kids but things changed, and that's the way it is" All that is in my power as of now is to hope that you take this post seriously...when you read it once, you'll think I am crazy, read it twice you'll think about it... read it three times... ...you'll cry. All I can say is that I hide my true sadness for this world... But when i'm alone... ...all I do when I look at this world together is cry... Forget all of my previous posts in this blog..... ....this is the real me.... im sorry but I have to go....

Has anyone ever heard of the band "The Undertones." I got the CD yesterday, deciding to take my chances, and I have come to find that they were really popular in Great Britain in the late 70's and early 80's, and even in the U.S were semi-popular. I really like their music, because it is old-school punk, and I LOVE punk music, and garage, and rock...I love it all. And, inevitably, I checked out a Pearl Jam CD, too, they're cool too, because a little Grunge is OK once in a while, but too much can drag you down into a seemingly endless abiss. OK...thats it.

OK, so here's the story. I needed a new bike, so my dad's friend Stan decided to let us have his retro 1972 green bike, and it sounds like a really cool bike (you know me, a retro freak), but my dad had been lazy in taking me to get it! I N E E D A NEW BIKE NOW!!! AAAARRRRRRGGGHH!!! > Here are more quizzes! YOU CAN'T ESCAPE THEM!!! MMMMWWWWAHAHAHAHAHA!!!! -Perfect- You're the perfect girlfriend. Which means you're rare or that you cheated :P You're the kind of chick that can hang out with your boyfriend's friends and be silly. You don't care about presents or about going to fancy placed. Hell, just hang out. You're just happy being around your boyfriend. urlLink What Kind of Girlfriend Are You? brought to you by urlLink Quizilla Pop punk... I'm not really that fond of you, but you can churn out some good stuff... Old punk doesn't really like you but you couldn't care less...besides it's all about having fun isn't it? urlLink What genre of rock are you? brought to you by urlLink Quizilla Then I took it again in a different mood...it depends I guess... Old school punk! You just say what you have to say regardless of what everyone else thinks! You're one of my most favourite types of music... You're raw and uncut! You're surrounded by hype...just don't let it make you go insane... urlLink What genre of rock are you? brought to you by urlLink Quizilla

You wake up late for school man you don't wanna go You ask you mom, "Please?" but she still says, "No!" You missed two classes and no homework But your teacher preaches class like you're some kind of jerk Chorus: You gotta fight for your right to party! You pop caught you smoking and he said, "No way!" That hypocrite smokes two packs a day Man, living at home is such a drag Now your mom threw away your best porno mag (Bust it!) (Chorus) Don't step out of this house if that's the clothes you're gonna wear I'll kick you out of my home if you don't cut that hair Your mom busted in and said, "What's that noise?" Aw, mom you're just jealous it's the Beastie Boys! (Chorus x2)

So she said what's the problem baby What's the problem I don't know Well maybe I'm in love (love) Think about it every time I think about it Can't stop thinking 'bout it How much longer will it take to cure this Just to cure it cause I can't ignore it if it's love (love) Makes me wanna turn around and face me but I don't know nothing 'bout love Come on, come on Turn a little faster Come on, come on The world will follow after Come on, come on Cause everybody's after love So I said I'm a snowball running Running down into the spring that's coming all this love Melting under blue skies Belting out sunlight Shimmering love Well baby I surrender To the strawberry ice cream Never ever end of all this love Well I didn't mean to do it But there's no escaping your love These lines of lightning Mean we're never alone, Never alone, no, no Come on, Come on Move a little closer Come on, Come on I want to hear you whisper Come on, Come on Settle down inside my love Come on, come on Jump a little higher Come on, come on If you feel a little lighter Come on, come on We were once Upon a time in love We're accidentally in love Accidentally in love (x7) Accidentally I'm In Love, I'm in Love, I'm in Love, I'm in Love, I'm in Love, I'm in Love, Accidentally (X 2) Come on, come on Spin a little tighter Come on, come on And the world's a little brighter Come on, come on Just get yourself inside her Love ...I'm in love

I just got done watching what is now my favorite movie of all time, all around great movie for my age: The Breakfast Club Along with Sixteen Candles and Less Than Zero, these movies will never change in explaining problems of the individual person, no matter what group. Dork. Jock. Princess. Basketcase. and Criminal.

Well, I gotta say, that was pretty fun. It wasn't as bad as I thought, having different personalities clash like that for almost 2 weeks. Yesterday was fun, too. I got three new CDs in one day, and a Rainbow Brite doll that I have been wanting for about 5 months. The Three Cds include Punk-O-Rama #8, an 80's movie hits CD with such songs as "If You Leave" "Maniac" and "Bette Davis Eyes" Which is the song that drives my Dad crazy. Hahaha. And the last CD I got, and don't come after me for this, The Greatest Hits of Elton John. Ah, donthitme! So, i'm happy things are starting to unwind after 4 weeks of family, and getting sick of them altogether...*clenches teeth* especially YOU BRATTANY WEAN SPAZNEY!!! (Brittany Jean C.) Anyways... Have a nice freakin' day, morons and peons.

OOOOOHH! THAT WAS SOOOOOO MUCH FUN! I just got back from a party at my friend Brittany's house, from 4 to 10, and it was SSSOOOOOO much fun. Well, actually, it got fun at about 6:30, when me, Romi, Tom, Micheal and a hyperactive friend of Emily's, and Mike, who watched and joked around, started to play Spoons...well...it turned into forks. lol. Then, soon after that started the band that came over left, and things finally got fun between the people that I knew. I sat between Romi and Mike on the swing, and Brittany sat on Mikes lap, and Tom sat next to Romi...and then we swung for about 45 minutes. We talked, told jokes and stories from this summer, and I got relly uncomfortable when someone, I don't recall who, brought up the subject of Vampires. Mike REALLY freaked me out because Mike sat RIGHT NEXT TO ME. Now, he reminded me of one of my cousin Steve's friends cause of his personality, but he has the hairstyle where you shave the sides of your head and leve the hair one inch on each side of your hairline, including the back, and he has a mustach and goutee sort of thing, and he's about 5'8", or 9", whatever. He kinda scares me, but I like him, he's cool. I got along with him, but we messed around with each other a lot (not THAT way sickos) > BOOM! We fell down to the ground! It was so funny, me and Mike couldn't stop laughing. LOL!!! So, it was a good night, So... Good night

Well, the reunion was nothing special, but the auction that we have was really funny. Everyone was getting everyone else really up there on the prices, especially my dad. Hahahahaha! And my Nana and Papa are back from visiting in Rockford (ick...Rockford, barf) Anyways, I finally went to Deaf Ear Records (DER), and got everything I wanted...and no CDs. Ha. i got an Aqua Teen Hunger Force t-shirt with the moonanites on it, a patch of M-Shake, Meatwad, and Frylock on it, a Ramones patch, and many small buttons. Awesome. One even has GIR riing a pig and one of Gaz. So in other news, i'm bummed that ATHF is going to be canceled. It SUCKS and those ppl SUCK!! !@#$%& Bye! !@#$%&*

Everyone is gone, it's just me...ME ME MEEEEE! ALONE YAY!!! Anyways, the song of the moment for me is "Goodbye Yellow Brick Road" by Elton John, its a really touching song to me... When are you gonna come down When are you going to land I should have stayed on the farm I should have listened to my old man You know you can't hold me forever I didn't sign up with you I'm not a present for your friends to open This boy's too young to be singing the blues So goodbye yellow brick road Where the dogs of society howl You can't plant me in your penthouse I'm going back to my plough Back to the howling old owl in the woods Hunting the horny back toad Oh I've finally decided my future lies Beyond the yellow brick road What do you think you'll do then I bet that'll shoot down your plane It'll take you a couple of vodka and tonics To set you on your feet again Maybe you'll get a replacement There's plenty like me to be found Mongrels who ain't got a penny Sniffing for tidbits like you on the ground
